sub_topic: Determining the length of a side in an isosceles triangle.
message_1: In an isosceles triangle, if the length of one of the equal sides is 6 cm and the base angle opposite to it is 45 degrees, what is the length of the other equal side?
message_2: In an isosceles triangle, the two equal sides are opposite to the two equal base angles. Since the length of one of the equal sides is given as 6 cm and the base angle opposite to it is 45 degrees, the other equal side will also have a length of 6 cm.
